text: hi everyone sometimes you need to make a
dessert for a barbecue a birthday or
another summer occasion and if you're
anything like me the last thing you want
to do on a hot day is turn on your oven
that's why I love this no baked key lime
cheesecake not only is it delicious but
it will keep you and your kitchen cool
too so I have here one cup of finely
ground graham cracker crumbs this is
nine crackers in the food processor or
you can always do it the old-fashioned
way with a resealable bag and a rolling
pin just give them a good crush and to
that I'm adding three tablespoons of
sugar 1/2 teaspoon of kosher salt and
then I'll give that a quick whisk just
to combine I love adding salt to the
crust here it works so well with the
citrus flavor all right that looks good
and then I'm adding five tablespoons of
melted unsalted butter I'll stir this
just until it's the texture of wet
crumbs all right this is looking pretty
good we just want it to clump together
like this you can see it's staying
together now I'll just dump this
straight into the pan this is a 9-inch
springform pan and then I like to use a
measuring cup to tamp the crust in I
kind of move the crumbs around until
they're evenly layered in the bottom of
the pan all right so this looks pretty
evenly pressed in here I'm just going to
put this in the freezer until it's firm
for 15 minutes so now I'm ready to make
the filling and this is so easy I just
have two 8-ounce blocks of cream cheese
and to that I'm adding 1 can of
sweetened condensed milk now I'm going
to get this going for about 5 minutes we
do want to aerate a little bit so it's
nice and incorporated just really fluffy
while this is mixing I'm going to start
whisking my whipped cream
so 1/2 cup of heavy cream I'm going to
whisk it until it's just all right this
looks great
it's nice smooth and fluffy give this a
scrape down the hole really quick just
to make sure yeah it looks good so I'm
going to finish with you mix 250 clearly
quickly I'm about there it really
doesn't take long for half a cup of
cream helps if your cream is cold it
will whisk up really quickly
sometimes I'll even put the entire bowl
in the fridge for about 5 minutes and
then it goes really fast all right that
looks nice and stiff now I'm going to
add the flavor to our mixture here this
is 1/3 of a cup of key lime juice and
this is two teaspoons of grated key lime
zest and then adding 1/2 teaspoon of
vanilla just pure vanilla extract so
i'll mix this together for about a
minute more until everything is combined
all right great this looks good
once again giving it a scrape so we're
ready to fold in our whipped cream nice
stiff peaks here this will help add even
more fluffy texture to our cheesecake
we're skin is gently fold this in so
swoops through the center and around the
side you don't want to overdo it but you
want to make sure that you don't have
any bites of whipped cream in there my
mixture is ready so I'm going to go grab
my crust so I have my chill prepare and
my light fluffy cheesecake mixture real
easy guys
you just pour it into your prepared pan
and this is going to chill for at least
12 hours and up to three days this is
one of those things that really does get
better with a little bit of time because
the whipped cream in the mixture kind of
varies a little bit and makes it really
beautiful which is exactly what you want
in the summer just spread it out to the
edges around here make it nice and even
I kind of like leaving it a little bit
soupy on top I think that's really
pretty that's it I'll just wrap this
slightly with plastic so it doesn't take
on any fridge odors now we're ready for
the fridge my cheesecake is ready I'm so
excited to get into this so to loosen it
from the pan I'm using a small paring
knife and I'm just running around the
edges kind of in a sawing motion all
right all the way around just like that
and now this should just come out loosen
the ring
lift it up oh there it is
looks so good and now I'm just going to
keep this on the base and move it onto
my serving plate you don't have to if
you want to remove it you can always
take a really sharp knife and slice just
right underneath the crust I think this
makes it really easy to transport so I'm
leaving it just like that and now I'm
going garnish so I have really cute key
limes here this is what a key lime looks
like if you haven't seen them before
it's basically a mini line
I think they're so adorable if you can't
find them you can always use a regular
line think this would also be really
great with any other kind of citrus and
I'm just going to slice nice little thin
pinwheels I love using a fresh garnish
on top of my desserts I think I'm just
going to pile these right in the middle
kind of scatter them on top of each
other
I love that this recipe is so easy as
you saw it it's not much more than just

it's really a light fluffy tropical
version of your favorite cheesecake I
